docs.abstract: The governor of Washington believes that proper investment in a clean energy economy will create 8 million well-paying jobs.
docs.snippet: The governor of Washington believes that proper investment in a clean energy economy will create 8 million well-paying jobs.
docs.lead_paragraph: Yes, Gov. Jay Inslee’s primary focus is combating climate change. But there’s more to it than that. Mr. Inslee believes that investing in a clean energy economy will lead to the creation of millions of jobs in communities across the country.

docs.abstract: Many of Mr. de Blasio’s accomplishments as mayor of New York City are tied to closing the wealth gap.
docs.snippet: Many of Mr. de Blasio’s accomplishments as mayor of New York City are tied to closing the wealth gap.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio rose to power by depicting New York as a city defined by its stark inequities. His run for president will test whether his brand of urban progressive leadership can be a model for the country.

headline.main: Bill de Blasio on Income Inequality

docs.abstract: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris face off again. Join Lisa Lerer and other Times reporters as they chat about what’s happening onstage.
docs.snippet: Joe Biden and Kamala Harris face off again. Join Lisa Lerer and other Times reporters as they chat about what’s happening onstage.
docs.lead_paragraph: Welcome to a special debate night edition of On Politics. I’m Lisa Lerer, your host.

headline.main: Debate Night 2: Join Our Live Chat

docs.abstract: The Democratic candidate for president and the powerful House freshman are building on the Green New Deal with a plan to prioritize low-income communities.
docs.snippet: The Democratic candidate for president and the powerful House freshman are building on the Green New Deal with a plan to prioritize low-income communities.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Kamala Harris of California and Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez of New York on Monday unveiled legislation aimed at ensuring that climate change plans benefit low-income communities. They described the measure as a key element of the Democrats’ Green New Deal.

headline.main: Kamala Harris and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Release Climate ‘Equity’ Plan
headline.print_headline: Climate Plan Aims to Aid ‘Vulnerable’ Communities

docs.abstract: Julián Castro, Tulsi Gabbard, Kirsten Gillibrand and Tom Steyer are getting closer to qualifying, and they’re urgently seeking supporters who can help them earn a spot onstage.
docs.snippet: Julián Castro, Tulsi Gabbard, Kirsten Gillibrand and Tom Steyer are getting closer to qualifying, and they’re urgently seeking supporters who can help them earn a spot onstage.
docs.lead_paragraph: [Update: Julián Castro was the 10th and final Democratic candidate to qualify for the September debate.]

headline.main: These Four Candidates Are Scrambling to Make the Cut for the Next Democratic Debate
headline.print_headline: Desperate Drive to Claim Spot in Next Debate

docs.abstract: A set of qualifying rules created a few final hours of uncertainty over who would qualify and whether the next debate would be held on one night or two. There was plenty of complaining.
docs.snippet: A set of qualifying rules created a few final hours of uncertainty over who would qualify and whether the next debate would be held on one night or two. There was plenty of complaining.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The suspense was high. The hour was late. The questions about the next Democratic debate were many: Ten candidates or 11? Two nights or one? One billionaire or none?

headline.main: Democratic Candidates Jostle, and Gripe, as Debates Winnow the Field
headline.print_headline: Candidates Jostle, and Gripe, As 2020 Debate Stage Shrinks

docs.abstract: No, you probably haven’t been polled. Yes, the polls are still valid.
docs.snippet: No, you probably haven’t been polled. Yes, the polls are still valid.
docs.lead_paragraph: Election polls have always been interesting. But this year, they have become official players in the Democratic presidential primary race, because polling badly means you don’t get to debate.

headline.main: Why You Can’t Volunteer for Election Polls, and Other Polling Facts
headline.print_headline: Why You Can’t Volunteer for Election Polls, and Other Polling Facts

docs.abstract: The former investor is an unlikely populist. But he is spending his fortune to try and get money out of politics.
docs.snippet: The former investor is an unlikely populist. But he is spending his fortune to try and get money out of politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — As Tom Steyer, the billionaire former hedge fund investor and impeachment impresario, made his first trip to Iowa as a 2020 candidate this month, he embarked on the usual political circuit.

headline.main: Tom Steyer Missed the Debate. He Has $100 Million To Disrupt the Race Anyway.
headline.print_headline: In Iowa, a Populist With a $100 Million Budget

docs.abstract: Mr. Moulton, a congressman from Massachusetts, had focused his campaign on national security. He hinted at potentially supporting Joseph R. Biden Jr.
docs.snippet: Mr. Moulton, a congressman from Massachusetts, had focused his campaign on national security. He hinted at potentially supporting Joseph R. Biden Jr.
docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Seth Moulton of Massachusetts has dropped out of the presidential race, ending a candidacy that emphasized Mr. Moulton’s centrist politics and military service but gained no traction with Democratic primary voters.

headline.main: Seth Moulton Ends 2020 Presidential Campaign With a Warning
headline.print_headline: Struggling to Gain Notice,  Congressman Ends ’20 Bid

docs.abstract: The billionaire, who died Friday, understood the power of changing “hearts and minds.” He spent almost unlimited money on behalf of limited government.
docs.snippet: The billionaire, who died Friday, understood the power of changing “hearts and minds.” He spent almost unlimited money on behalf of limited government.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1980, David H. Koch, one of the two billionaire industrialist brothers at the center of a sprawling and powerful political network, served as the Libertarian Party’s vice-presidential nominee. The ticket earned 1.1 percent.

headline.main: How David Koch and His Brother Shaped American Politics
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Embraced Koch Vision, Until Trump Tossed It All Aside
